Participants in 3rd National Meeting of Mothers Have Photo Session 
    Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 3rd National Meeting of Mothers had a photo session at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace plaza on Nov. 23.
 Kim Yong Nam, Kim Il Chol, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Jung Rin and leading officials of the working people's organizations had a picture taken with the participants.

Peasants' Rally Held in S. Korea
articles.content:
Peasants' Rally Held in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- A peasants rally to save Korean agriculture reportedly took place in Youido, Seoul on Monday under the sponsorship of the Committee for Urgent Measures for Checking "National Assembly's" Ratification of the Proposal for Rice Negotiations.
 Speakers at the rally warned that in case the NA passes the proposal, they would never step back but carry on their struggle defying detention and death till the peasants' demands have been met. They called for uniting as one and launching an all-out struggle for the survival of the nation.
 A 10-point demand for the defence of the food sovereignty and fundamental recovery of agriculture was released at the rally.    
 The rally was preceded by a memorial service for O Chu Ok, director for cultural affairs of the Women Farmers' Association in Songju County, North Kyongsang Province, who committed a suicide in protest against the NA passage of the proposal on the rice negotiations. Speakers at the service deplored that the government's unjustly conducted rice negotiations and failed agricultural policy are driving peasants to death.

Visits
articles.content:
Visits
    Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea headed by its Vice-Chairman Kim Yong Do left here today to participate in the 15th Congress of the World Federation of Trade Unions to be held in Cuba. Also departing here were a delegation of the General Bureau of Software Industry of the DPRK led by its Director Han U Chol to visit Russia and a delegation of the Bureau of Earthquake of the DPRK led by its Director Kang Sin Dong to visit China.
 A delegation of the Union of Democratic Korean Women in Japan led by Ryang Ok Chul, vice-chairperson of the Central Standing Committee of the union, Thursday left here after participating in the 3rd national meeting of mothers.
